medical_history.history_of_present_illness: Symptoms began 4 days prior to emergency room visit. The patient presented with abdominal pain and a CT scan showed a small amount of free air. Symptoms progressed with a significantly large amount of ascites.
medical_history.past_medical_history: HCV cirrhosis, Child B class, MELD score 9, decompensated with ascites and hepatic encephalopathy, non-bleeding esophageal varices, hepatic lesions, COPD, BPH, tobacco abuse, hypertension, gout, depression, arthritis, and 'nose disease' with epistaxis.
medical_history.family_history: Mother with CAD and DM; father passed away due to embolism.
